articles.title: Acting King of Jordan on Relations with DPRK
National Writers Meeting to Be Held in Pyongyang
articles.content:
Acting King of Jordan on Relations with DPRK 
    Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) --The royal family and government of Jordan, hoping that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries will continue to develop on good terms, will strive to this end.
 Faisal Bin al Hussein, acting king of Jordan, said this when DPRK Ambassador Kim Pyong Nam presented his credentials to him on June 9.    
 He hoped that exchange would be boosted in the sectors of trade, culture and technology between the two countries.

articles.title: KCNA Refutes U.S. Call for DPRK's CVID
articles.content:
National Writers Meeting to Be Held in Pyongyang 
    Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- Representatives of the Korean Writers Union and the Council of Writers of National Literature of south Korea had a contact at Mt. Kumgang resort between June 8 and 10, Juche 93 (2004), at which they agreed to hold a national writers meeting to implement the June 15 North-South Joint Declaration in Pyongyang, visit the city and Mt. Myohyang and hold such functions as " Dawn of Literature for Reunification" in Mt. Paektu in late August.

Spokesman for DPRK FM Ministry on Third Round of Six-Party Talks
Kim Yong Nam Sends Congratulations to British Queen
U.S. under Fire for Hamstringing Implementation of North-South Joint Declaration
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Congratulations to British Queen
    Pyongyang, June 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a congratulatory message to Elizabeth II, the queen of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland, on June 12 on her birthday, the official holiday.
 The president in the message expressed the belief that the favourably developing relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future and wished her good health and happiness.
